relation: Treatment-experienced HIV-1 infected participants took by mouth atazanavir (ATV)/low-dose ritonavir (rtv) 300/100 mg once daily + 2 nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs) for 2 weeks (Pre-treatment Period) followed by ATV/rtv 300/100 mg once daily + etravirine (ETR) 200 mg twice daily + 1 NRTI for 48 weeks (Treatment A).

Treatment-experienced HIV-1 infected participants took by mouth atazanavir (ATV)/low-dose ritonavir (rtv) 300/100 mg once daily + 2 nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs) for 2 weeks (Pre-treatment Period) followed by ATV/rtv 400/100 mg once daily + etravirine (ETR) 200 mg twice daily + 1 NRTI for 48 weeks (Treatment B).
pageTitle: TMC125-TiDP2-C238: An Exploratory Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Anti-HIV Activity Study of Etravirine (ETR) When Given With Boosted Atazanavir (ATV/Rtv) at Two Different Doses and 1 Nucleoside Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitor (NRTI) in Treatment Experienced HIV Patients - Study Results - ClinicalTrials.gov
textBeforeTable: Reporting Groups Fifty (50) participants were enrolled in the study and received treatment with study drug during a 2-week Pre-treatment Period (Week -2 to Day -1) and a 48-week Treatment Period (Day 1 to Week 48). Efficacy data are reported for the 48-week Treatment Period. Significant events and approaches for the overall study following participant enrollment, but prior to group assignment Pre-Assignment Details Etravirine coadministered with 2 doses of atazanavir/low-dose ritonavir each combined with 1 nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor was evaluated in human immunodeficiency virus – type 1 infected participants. The study was conducted between 25 June 2009 and 10 April 2012 and participants were recruited by 17 investigators in 4 countries.
